simpledes: Government agricultural land is agricultural land owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds). Agricultural land is defined as land devoted to agriculture. The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/t-piketty-l-yang-and-g-zucman-capital-accumulation-private-property-and-inequality-in-china-1978-2015-2016/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Piketty, Thomas; Yang, Li and Zucman, Gabriel (2016). Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

shortname: Government business and other non-financial assets
simpledes: Government business and other non-financial assets are agricultural land and other domestic non-financial assets owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds). The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
technicaldes: [Government business and other non-financial assets]=[Government agricultural land]+[Government other domestic capital]+[Government natural capital]
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

simpledes: Government currency & deposits are cash and bank deposits owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds). The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
technicaldes: [Government financial assets excluding cash]=[Government currency, deposits, bonds & loans]-[Government bonds & loans]
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

simpledes: Government debt is debts or legal obligations owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds). The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/t-piketty-l-yang-and-g-zucman-capital-accumulation-private-property-and-inequality-in-china-1978-2015-2016/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Piketty, Thomas; Yang, Li and Zucman, Gabriel (2016). Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

simpledes: Net public wealth is the total value of assets (cash, housing, bonds, equities, etc.) owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds), minus its debts. The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
technicaldes: [Net public wealth]=[Government non-financial assets]+[Government financial assets]-[Government debt]
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/t-piketty-l-yang-and-g-zucman-capital-accumulation-private-property-and-inequality-in-china-1978-2015-2016/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Piketty, Thomas; Yang, Li and Zucman, Gabriel (2016). Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

simpledes: Government equities are company stocks owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds). The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

shortname: Government equity, fund shares & offshore wealth
simpledes: Government equity, fund shares & offshore wealth are company stocks, fund shares and wealth outside of one's residence country owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds). The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
technicaldes: [Government equity, fund shares & offshore wealth]=[Government equities]+[Government offshore wealth]
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

simpledes: Government financial assets excluding cash are financial assets except cash and bank deposits owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds). The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
technicaldes: [Government financial assets excluding cash]=[Government financial assets]-[Government currency & deposits]
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

simpledes: Government financial assets are intangible assets whose value is derived from a contractual claim (bank deposits, bonds, and stocks) owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds). The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
technicaldes: [Government financial assets]=[Government currency, deposits, bonds & loans]+[Government equity, fund shares & offshore wealth]+[Government pension funds & life insurance]
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

simpledes: Government housing assets are places of residence and land they built on owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds). The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
technicaldes: [Government housing assets]=[Government dwellings]+[Government land underlying dwellings]
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.

simpledes: Government non-financial assets are assets with a physical value (real estate, machinery, equipment, etc.) owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds). The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
technicaldes: [Government non-financial assets]=[Government housing assets]+[Government business and other non-financial assets]
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.

Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).

simpledes: Net personal wealth is  the total value of non-financial and financial assets (housing, land, deposits, bonds, equities, etc.) held by households, minus their debts. . The personal or household sector - in the national accounts sense - includes all households and private individuals (including those living in institutions), as well as unincorporated enterprises whose accounts are not separated from those of the households who own them.
technicaldes: [Net personal wealth]=[Personal non-financial assets]+[Personal financial assets]-[Personal debt]
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

method: WID.world estimations as a proportion of GDP based on the following; 1992–2016: [URL][URL_LINK]https://stats.oecd.org/Index.aspx?DataSetCode=SNA_TABLE14A[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]OECD[/URL_TEXT][/URL]. These estimates are then anchored to GDP (see GDP variable for details). The estimates of national accounts subcomponents in the WID are based on official country data and use the methodology presented in the [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/distributional-national-accounts-guidelines-2020-concepts-and-methods-used-in-the-world-inequality-database/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]DINA guidelines[/URL_TEXT][/URL]. We stress that these subcomponents estimates are more fragile than those of main aggregates such as national income. Countries may use classifications used are not always fully consistent with other countries or over time. Series breaks with no real economic significance can appear as a result. The WID include these estimates to provide a centralized source for this official data, so that it can be exploited more directly. We encourage users of this data to be careful and to pay attention to the source of the data, which we systematically indicate.

simpledes: Net domestic product is the total value of the goods and services produced in a country, minus the value of the fixed capital used up in production (e.g. replacement of obsolete machines or maintenance of roads).The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
technicaldes: [Net domestic product]=[Gross domestic product]-[Consumption of fixed capital]
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

simpledes: Net foreign income is the difference between the total value of a country's citizens and companies earned abroad, and the total value of foreign citizens and overseas companies earned in that country.The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
technicaldes: [Net foreign income]=[Property income received from the rest of the world]-[Property income paid from the rest of the world]+[Compensation of employees received from the rest of the world]-[Compensation of employees paid from the rest of the world]
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.

simpledes: National income aims to measure the total income available to the residents of a given country. It is equal to the gross domestic product (the total value of goods and services produced on the territory of a given country during a given year), minus fixed capital used in production processes (e.g. replacement of obsolete machines or maintenance of roads) plus the net foreign income earned by residents in the rest of the world.// National income has many limitations. However it is the only income concept that has an internationally agreed definition (established by the United Nations System of National Accounts, see SNA 2008). So we use it as our reference concept (with tax havens correction). To be improved.The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
technicaldes: [National income]=[Net domestic product]+[Net foreign income]
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

simpledes: National agricultural land is agricultural land owned by the national economy. Agricultural land is defined as land devoted to agriculture measured at their market value. The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/t-piketty-l-yang-and-g-zucman-capital-accumulation-private-property-and-inequality-in-china-1978-2015-2016/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Piketty, Thomas; Yang, Li and Zucman, Gabriel (2016). Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

simpledes: Book-value national wealth is the sum of value of assets according to the books (balance sheets) on which they are carried. It is the difference between net national wealth and national net corporate wealth. The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
technicaldes: [Book-value national wealth]=[Market-value national wealth ]+[Residual corporate wealth]
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

shortname: National business and other non-financial assets
simpledes: National business and other non-financial assets are agricultural land and other domestic non-financial assets owned by the national economy and measured at their market value.  The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
technicaldes: [National business and other non-financial assets]=[National other domestic capital]+[National agricultural land]+[National natural capital]
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

simpledes: Net national wealth is the total value of assets (cash, housing, bonds, equities, etc.) owned by the national economy, minus its debts. The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
technicaldes: [Market-value national wealth ]=[National non-financial assets]+[Net foreign assets]
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
technicaldes: [National housing assets]=[National dwellings]+[National land underlying dwellings]

The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
technicaldes: [National non-financial assets]=[National housing assets]+[National business and other non-financial assets]

Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

simpledes: Net foreign assets are the total value of the assets that a country owns abroad, minus the total value of the domestic assets owned by foreigners. These estimates are then anchored to GDP (see GDP variable for details). The estimates of national accounts subcomponents in the WID are based on official country data and use the methodology presented in the [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/distributional-national-accounts-guidelines-2020-concepts-and-methods-used-in-the-world-inequality-database/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]DINA guidelines[/URL_TEXT][/URL]. We stress that these subcomponents estimates are more fragile than those of main aggregates such as national income. Countries may use classifications used are not always fully consistent with other countries or over time. Series breaks with no real economic significance can appear as a result. The WID include these estimates to provide a centralized source for this official data, so that it can be exploited more directly. We encourage users of this data to be careful and to pay attention to the source of the data, which we systematically indicate.

simpledes: Private agricultural land is agricultural land held by private owners (households and foundations). The private sector - in the national accounts sense - includes the personal sector (households) and the non-profit sector (foundations, religious organizations, etc.). In certain countries, availables sources do not allow to decompose the wealth owned by each of these two sub-sectors, and we only provide total net private wealth.
technicaldes: [Private agricultural land]=[Personal agricultural land]+[Non-profit agricultural land]
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

simpledes: Net private wealth is  the total value of non-financial and financial assets (housing, land, deposits, bonds, equities of corporations, etc.) held by private owners (households and foundations), minus their debts.  The private sector - in the national accounts sense - includes the personal sector (households) and the non-profit sector (foundations, religious organizations, etc.). In certain countries, availables sources do not allow to decompose the wealth owned by each of these two sub-sectors, and we only provide total net private wealth.
technicaldes: [Net private wealth]=[Private non-financial assets]+[Private financial assets]-[Private debt]
longtype: Macroeconomic variable (i.e. corresponding to national economy rather than to a given group of individuals). The associated percentile is of the form 'pall'.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: See [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/distributional-national-accounts-guidelines-2020-concepts-and-methods-used-in-the-world-inequality-database/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]DINA guidelines[/URL_TEXT][/URL].
method: WID.world estimations as a proportion of GDP based on the following; 1992–2016: estimated from other components. These estimates are then anchored to GDP (see GDP variable for details). The estimates of national accounts subcomponents in the WID are based on official country data and use the methodology presented in the [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/distributional-national-accounts-guidelines-2020-concepts-and-methods-used-in-the-world-inequality-database/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]DINA guidelines[/URL_TEXT][/URL]. We stress that these subcomponents estimates are more fragile than those of main aggregates such as national income. Countries may use classifications used are not always fully consistent with other countries or over time. Series breaks with no real economic significance can appear as a result. The WID include these estimates to provide a centralized source for this official data, so that it can be exploited more directly. We encourage users of this data to be careful and to pay attention to the source of the data, which we systematically indicate.

The estimates of national accounts subcomponents in the WID are based on official country data and use the methodology presented in the [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/distributional-national-accounts-guidelines-2020-concepts-and-methods-used-in-the-world-inequality-database/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]DINA guidelines[/URL_TEXT][/URL]. We stress that these subcomponents estimates are more fragile than those of main aggregates such as national income. Countries may use classifications used are not always fully consistent with other countries or over time. Series breaks with no real economic significance can appear as a result. The WID include these estimates to provide a centralized source for this official data, so that it can be exploited more directly. We encourage users of this data to be careful and to pay attention to the source of the data, which we systematically indicate.

The estimates of national accounts subcomponents in the WID are based on official country data and use the methodology presented in the [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/distributional-national-accounts-guidelines-2020-concepts-and-methods-used-in-the-world-inequality-database/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]DINA guidelines[/URL_TEXT][/URL]. We stress that these subcomponents estimates are more fragile than those of main aggregates such as national income. Countries may use classifications used are not always fully consistent with other countries or over time. Series breaks with no real economic significance can appear as a result. The WID include these estimates to provide a centralized source for this official data, so that it can be exploited more directly. We encourage users of this data to be careful and to pay attention to the source of the data, which we systematically indicate.

simpledes: Post-tax national income is the sum of primary incomes over all sectors (private and public), minus taxes.
technicaldes: [Post-tax national income]=[Post-tax disposable income]+[Public spending]
longtype: Ratio of Top 10% average income to Bottom 50% average income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals over age 20.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/government-redistribution-and-development-global-estimates-of-tax-and-transfer-progressivity-1980-2019-wid-world-working-paper-2023-17/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Fisher-Post, Matthew and Gethin, Amory (2023), "Government Redistribution and Development, Global Estimates of Tax-and-Transfer Progressivity, 1980-2019" [/URL_TEXT][/URL]
method: 2019-2021 series are estimated by applying the 2018 ratio of pretax to posttax income by generalized percentile.

simpledes: Net personal wealth is  the total value of non-financial and financial assets (housing, land, deposits, bonds, equities, etc.) held by households, minus their debts. . The personal or household sector - in the national accounts sense - includes all households and private individuals (including those living in institutions), as well as unincorporated enterprises whose accounts are not separated from those of the households who own them.
technicaldes: [Net personal wealth]=[Personal non-financial assets]+[Personal financial assets]-[Personal debt]
longtype: Ratio of Top 10% average income to Bottom 50% average income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals over age 20.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/t-piketty-l-yang-and-g-zucman-capital-accumulation-private-property-and-inequality-in-china-1978-2015-2016/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Piketty, Thomas; Yang, Li and Zucman, Gabriel (2016). Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015; [/URL_TEXT][/URL][URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/2022-dina-regional-update-for-east-asia-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2022-04/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by Sehyun, H., Zhexun, M. (2022), "2022 Regional DINA Update for Asia"; [/URL_TEXT][/URL]

simpledes: Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income.
technicaldes: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
longtype: Ratio of Top 10% average income to Bottom 50% average income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals over age 20.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/t-piketty-l-yang-and-g-zucman-capital-accumulation-private-property-and-inequality-in-china-1978-2015-2016/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Piketty, Thomas; Yang, Li and Zucman, Gabriel (2016). Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015; [/URL_TEXT][/URL][URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/2022-dina-regional-update-for-east-asia-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2022-04/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by Sehyun, H., Zhexun, M. (2022), "2022 Regional DINA Update for Asia"; [/URL_TEXT][/URL]; For long run series (full population), [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/longrunpaper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, L., Piketty, T. simpledes: Post-tax national income is the sum of primary incomes over all sectors (private and public), minus taxes.
technicaldes: [Post-tax national income]=[Post-tax disposable income]+[Public spending]
longtype: Income or wealth shares. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pX', the raw data stores the share of total income or wealth detained by all the population between threshold pX and the top of the distribution. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pXpY', the raw data stores the share of the population between thresholds pX and pY.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals over age 20.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/government-redistribution-and-development-global-estimates-of-tax-and-transfer-progressivity-1980-2019-wid-world-working-paper-2023-17/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Fisher-Post, Matthew and Gethin, Amory (2023), "Government Redistribution and Development, Global Estimates of Tax-and-Transfer Progressivity, 1980-2019" [/URL_TEXT][/URL]
method: 2019-2021 series are estimated by applying the 2018 ratio of pretax to posttax income by generalized percentile.

simpledes: Fiscal income is defined as the sum of all income items reported on income tax returns, before any deduction. It includes labour income, capital income and mixed income. The concept of fiscal income varies with national tax legislations, so in order to make international comparisons it is preferable to use the concept of national income.
technicaldes: [Fiscal income ]=[Fiscal labour income [total fiscal income ranking]]+[Fiscal capital income [total fiscal income ranking]]
longtype: Income or wealth shares. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pX', the raw data stores the share of total income or wealth detained by all the population between threshold pX and the top of the distribution. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pXpY', the raw data stores the share of the population between thresholds pX and pY.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals over age 20.

Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

simpledes: Net personal wealth is  the total value of non-financial and financial assets (housing, land, deposits, bonds, equities, etc.) held by households, minus their debts. . The personal or household sector - in the national accounts sense - includes all households and private individuals (including those living in institutions), as well as unincorporated enterprises whose accounts are not separated from those of the households who own them.
technicaldes: [Net personal wealth]=[Personal non-financial assets]+[Personal financial assets]-[Personal debt]
longtype: Income or wealth shares. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pX', the raw data stores the share of total income or wealth detained by all the population between threshold pX and the top of the distribution. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pXpY', the raw data stores the share of the population between thresholds pX and pY.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals over age 20.

(2022), "2022 Regional DINA Update for Asia"; [/URL_TEXT][/URL]

shortname: Pre-tax labor income [pre-tax labor income ranking]
simpledes: Pre-tax labor income [pre-tax labor income ranking] is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the individual owners of labor as a production factor, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income.
technicaldes: Pre-tax labor income [pre-tax labor income ranking]=Compensation of employees [pre-tax labor income ranking]+Labor component of net mixed income [pre-tax labor income ranking]+Pensions and social insurance income (labor share) [pre-tax labor income ranking]
longtype: Income or wealth shares. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pX', the raw data stores the share of total income or wealth detained by all the population between threshold pX and the top of the distribution. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pXpY', the raw data stores the share of the population between thresholds pX and pY.
longpop: The population looked at is comprised of female individuals only.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals over age 20.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/half-the-sky-the-female-labor-income-share-in-a-global-perspective-world-inequality-lab-working-paper-2021-22/ [/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Neef, T., Robilliard, A.-S. (2021), “Half the sky? The Female Labor Income Share in a Global Perspective”[/URL_TEXT][/URL]
method: The age of the adult population is 15 years and older

The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income.
technicaldes: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
longtype: Income or wealth shares. longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals over age 20.

simpledes: Corporate agricultural land is agricultural land owned by the corporate sector (companies). Agricultural land is defined as land devoted to agriculture. The corporate sector - in the national accounts sense - includes all financial and non-financial corporations with an economic activity in a given country, whatever their legal status (with the exceptions of unincorporated enterprises included in the personal sector).
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

simpledes: The corporate sector - in the national accounts sense - includes all financial and non-financial corporations with an economic activity in a given country, whatever their legal status (with the exceptions of unincorporated enterprises included in the personal sector).
technicaldes: [Book value of corporations]=[Corporate non-financial assets ]-[Corporate debt (non-equity liability)]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.

simpledes: Corporate business and other non-financial assets are agricultural land and other domestic non-financial assets owned by the corporate sector (companies). The corporate sector - in the national accounts sense - includes all financial and non-financial corporations with an economic activity in a given country, whatever their legal status (with the exceptions of unincorporated enterprises included in the personal sector).
technicaldes: [Corporate business and other non-financial assets ]=[Corporate agricultural land]+[Corporate other domestic capital]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

simpledes: Corporate financial assets are intangible assets whose value is derived from a contractual claim (bank deposits, bonds, and stocks) owned by the corporate sector (companies). The corporate sector - in the national accounts sense - includes all financial and non-financial corporations with an economic activity in a given country, whatever their legal status (with the exceptions of unincorporated enterprises included in the personal sector).
technicaldes: [Corporate financial assets]=[Corporate currency, deposits, bonds & loans]+[Corporate equity, fund shares & offshore wealth]+[Corporate pension funds & life insurance]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.

simpledes: Corporate housing assets are places of residence and land they built on owned by the corporate sector (companies). The corporate sector - in the national accounts sense - includes all financial and non-financial corporations with an economic activity in a given country, whatever their legal status (with the exceptions of unincorporated enterprises included in the personal sector).
technicaldes: [Corporate housing assets ]=[Corporate dwellings ]+[Corporate land underlying dwellings ]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

technicaldes: [Corporate non-financial assets ]=[Corporate housing assets ]+[Corporate business and other non-financial assets ]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.

simpledes: Government agricultural land is agricultural land owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds). Agricultural land is defined as land devoted to agriculture. The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.

simpledes: Government debt is debts or legal obligations owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds). The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/t-piketty-l-yang-and-g-zucman-capital-accumulation-private-property-and-inequality-in-china-1978-2015-2016/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Piketty, Thomas; Yang, Li and Zucman, Gabriel (2016). Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

simpledes: Net public wealth is the total value of assets (cash, housing, bonds, equities, etc.) owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds), minus its debts. The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
technicaldes: [Net public wealth]=[Government non-financial assets]+[Government financial assets]-[Government debt]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/t-piketty-l-yang-and-g-zucman-capital-accumulation-private-property-and-inequality-in-china-1978-2015-2016/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Piketty, Thomas; Yang, Li and Zucman, Gabriel (2016). Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

simpledes: Government equities are company stocks owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds). The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

simpledes: Government financial assets excluding cash are financial assets except cash and bank deposits owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds). The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
technicaldes: [Government financial assets excluding cash]=[Government financial assets]-[Government currency & deposits]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

simpledes: Government financial assets are intangible assets whose value is derived from a contractual claim (bank deposits, bonds, and stocks) owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds). The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
technicaldes: [Government financial assets]=[Government currency, deposits, bonds & loans]+[Government equity, fund shares & offshore wealth]+[Government pension funds & life insurance]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

simpledes: Government housing assets are places of residence and land they built on owned by the general government sector (central government, state government, local government, and social security funds). The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
technicaldes: [Government housing assets]=[Government dwellings]+[Government land underlying dwellings]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

The government sector - in the national accounts - includes are national, regional local governement, social security administrations, and more generally all entities relying primarily upon public financing (taxes, contributions, and other compulsory payments).
technicaldes: [Government non-financial assets]=[Government housing assets]+[Government business and other non-financial assets]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

simpledes: National agricultural land is agricultural land owned by the national economy. Agricultural land is defined as land devoted to agriculture measured at their market value. The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/t-piketty-l-yang-and-g-zucman-capital-accumulation-private-property-and-inequality-in-china-1978-2015-2016/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Piketty, Thomas; Yang, Li and Zucman, Gabriel (2016). Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

simpledes: Book-value national wealth is the sum of value of assets according to the books (balance sheets) on which they are carried. It is the difference between net national wealth and national net corporate wealth. The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
technicaldes: [Book-value national wealth]=[Market-value national wealth ]+[Residual corporate wealth]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

shortname: National business and other non-financial assets
simpledes: National business and other non-financial assets are agricultural land and other domestic non-financial assets owned by the national economy and measured at their market value.  The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
technicaldes: [National business and other non-financial assets]=[National other domestic capital]+[National agricultural land]+[National natural capital]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

simpledes: Net national wealth is the total value of assets (cash, housing, bonds, equities, etc.) owned by the national economy, minus its debts. The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
technicaldes: [Market-value national wealth ]=[National non-financial assets]+[Net foreign assets]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

simpledes: Gross foreign assets are the total value of the assets that country owns abroad. The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.

simpledes: Gross foreign liabilities are the total value of the domestic assets owned by foreigners. The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.

simpledes: National housing assets are places of residence and land they built on owned by the national economy and measured at their market value.  The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
technicaldes: [National housing assets]=[National dwellings]+[National land underlying dwellings]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income

simpledes: National market non-financial assets are assets with a physical value (real estate, machinery, equipment, etc.) owned by the national economy and measured at their market value.  The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
technicaldes: [National non-financial assets]=[National housing assets]+[National business and other non-financial assets]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.

simpledes: Net foreign assets are the total value of the assets that a country owns abroad, minus the total value of the domestic assets owned by foreigners. The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
technicaldes: [Net foreign assets]=[Gross foreign assets]-[Gross foreign liabilities]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

simpledes: Private agricultural land is agricultural land held by private owners (households and foundations). The private sector - in the national accounts sense - includes the personal sector (households) and the non-profit sector (foundations, religious organizations, etc.). In certain countries, availables sources do not allow to decompose the wealth owned by each of these two sub-sectors, and we only provide total net private wealth.
technicaldes: [Private agricultural land]=[Personal agricultural land]+[Non-profit agricultural land]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

simpledes: Private bonds & loans are bonds and loans held by private owners (households and foundations). The private sector - in the national accounts sense - includes the personal sector (households) and the non-profit sector (foundations, religious organizations, etc.). In certain countries, availables sources do not allow to decompose the wealth owned by each of these two sub-sectors, and we only provide total net private wealth.
technicaldes: [Private bonds & loans]=[Personal bonds & loans]+[Non-profit bonds & loans]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

simpledes: Private business assets include agricultural land and other domestic material and immaterial non-financial assets (machinery, equipment, patents, etc.) held by private owners (households and foundations). The private sector - in the national accounts sense - includes the personal sector (households) and the non-profit sector (foundations, religious organizations, etc.). In certain countries, availables sources do not allow to decompose the wealth owned by each of these two sub-sectors, and we only provide total net private wealth.
technicaldes: [Private business assets]=[Private agricultural land]+[Other domestic private capital]+[Private natural capital]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

simpledes: Private currency & deposits are cash and bank deposits held by private owners (households and foundations). The private sector - in the national accounts sense - includes the personal sector (households) and the non-profit sector (foundations, religious organizations, etc.). In certain countries, availables sources do not allow to decompose the wealth owned by each of these two sub-sectors, and we only provide total net private wealth.
technicaldes: [Private currency & deposits]=[Personal currency & deposits]+[Non-profit currency & deposits]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.

simpledes: Private debt is debts or legal obligations held by private owners (households and foundations). The private sector - in the national accounts sense - includes the personal sector (households) and the non-profit sector (foundations, religious organizations, etc.). In certain countries, availables sources do not allow to decompose the wealth owned by each of these two sub-sectors, and we only provide total net private wealth.
technicaldes: [Private debt]=[Personal debt]+[Non-profit debt]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income

simpledes: Net private wealth is  the total value of non-financial and financial assets (housing, land, deposits, bonds, equities of corporations, etc.) held by private owners (households and foundations), minus their debts.  The private sector - in the national accounts sense - includes the personal sector (households) and the non-profit sector (foundations, religious organizations, etc.). In certain countries, availables sources do not allow to decompose the wealth owned by each of these two sub-sectors, and we only provide total net private wealth.
technicaldes: [Net private wealth]=[Private non-financial assets]+[Private financial assets]-[Private debt]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income

longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

The private sector - in the national accounts sense - includes the personal sector (households) and the non-profit sector (foundations, religious organizations, etc.). In certain countries, availables sources do not allow to decompose the wealth owned by each of these two sub-sectors, and we only provide total net private wealth.
technicaldes: [Private equities]=[Personal equities]+[Non-profit equities]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

The private sector - in the national accounts sense - includes the personal sector (households) and the non-profit sector (foundations, religious organizations, etc.). In certain countries, availables sources do not allow to decompose the wealth owned by each of these two sub-sectors, and we only provide total net private wealth.

The private sector - in the national accounts sense - includes the personal sector (households) and the non-profit sector (foundations, religious organizations, etc.). shortname: Net Corporate Wealth to Net National Income Ratio
simpledes: Net Corporate Wealth to Net National Income Ratio is the division of net wealth of the corporate sector (companies) by net national income.
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/t-piketty-l-yang-and-g-zucman-capital-accumulation-private-property-and-inequality-in-china-1978-2015-2016/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Piketty, Thomas; Yang, Li and Zucman, Gabriel (2016). Capital Accumulation, Private Property and Rising Inequality in China, 1978-2015[/URL_TEXT][/URL];

shortname: Net Public Wealth to Net National Income Ratio
simpledes: Net Public Wealth to Net National Income Ratio is the division of net wealth of the public sector by net national income.
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: WID.world estimates based on macro aggregates: see method and corresponding macro variables for details.
method: Public wealth-to-income ratio defined as the ratio of government wealth to market-price national income. See [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/distributional-national-accounts-guidelines-2020-concepts-and-methods-used-in-the-world-inequality-database/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]DINA Guidelines[/URL_TEXT][/URL] for details.

shortname: Net Personal Wealth to Net National Income Ratio
simpledes: Net Personal Wealth to Net National Income Ratio is the division of net wealth of the personal sector (households) by net national income.
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: WID.world estimates based on macro aggregates: see method and corresponding macro variables for details.
method: Household wealth-to-income ratio defined as the ratio of household wealth to market-price national income. See [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/distributional-national-accounts-guidelines-2020-concepts-and-methods-used-in-the-world-inequality-database/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]DINA Guidelines[/URL_TEXT][/URL] for details.

shortname: Net national wealth to Net National Income Ratio
simpledes: Wealth-Income Ratio is the division of national wealth by national income.
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: WID.world estimates based on macro aggregates: see method and corresponding macro variables for details.
method: National wealth-to-income ratio defined as the ratio of market-price national wealth to market-price national income. See [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/distributional-national-accounts-guidelines-2020-concepts-and-methods-used-in-the-world-inequality-database/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]DINA Guidelines[/URL_TEXT][/URL] for details.

shortname: Net Private Wealth to Net National Income Ratio
simpledes: Net Private Wealth to Net National Income Ratio is the division of net private wealth by net national income. Private wealth consists of net wealth of the personal sector (households) and the non-profit sector (philanthropy foundations, religious organizations, universities, etc.).
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: WID.world estimates based on macro aggregates: see method and corresponding macro variables for details.
method: Private wealth-to-income ratio defined as the ratio of household and NPISH wealth to market-price national income. See [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/distributional-national-accounts-guidelines-2020-concepts-and-methods-used-in-the-world-inequality-database/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]DINA Guidelines[/URL_TEXT][/URL] for details.

shortname: PPP conversion factor, LCU per EUR
